meanings.definition: To mark or color with red
meanings.sent1: She rubricates the important words in her notes with a red pen.
meanings.sent2: The artist rubricates the painting with vibrant red strokes.
meanings.sent3: The teacher accidentally rubricates the whiteboard instead of the paper.
meanings.sent4: His passion rubricates his cheeks with a deep red hue.
meanings.sent5: The setting sun rubricates the sky in a fiery red glow.

meanings.definition: To add explanatory notes or headings to a text
meanings.sent1: He rubricates the textbook with helpful notes for studying.
meanings.sent2: The editor rubricates the manuscript with detailed explanations.
meanings.sent3: The student playfully rubricates the margins with doodles instead of notes.
meanings.sent4: Her mind rubricates the story with vivid mental images.
meanings.sent5: The historian rubricates the document with insightful annotations.
